fields.description: If a URL is used in the redirect macros 'location' parameter it ends up being stored like this - {noformat} https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Viewing+Installed+Add-ons {noformat} The tag within the parameter breaks {{com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.storage.macro.StorageMacroV2Unmarshaller.parseV2Parameter(XMLEventReader, FragmentTransformer, ConversionContext, MacroParameter, Map, String)}}. This means that the macro cannot be edited again. It should in my mind make the macro non-functional as well but it does still seem to work (i.e. in view mode) which is strange. The root problem is that the location parameter has metadata describing it as 'confluence-content' when it can actually be content or a free URL. However it could be that prior to 5.3.2 changes the unmarshaller would still handle the badly formatted redirect macro definition. (See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31382) There are a few approaches to fixing this - 1) Raise an issue with Customware to have the redirect macro fixed. If it wants to continue to benefit from using the 'confluence-content' type (e.g. autocompletion in the Macro Browser) then it will likely need to introduce a second parameter for URL redirects. This will be quite a substantial change likely needing a migration task as well. 2) We further hack the StorageMacroV2Unmarshaller to handle this invalid macro parameter. 3) We try to find a way for macro marshalling to storage to detect this misuse of a parameter and fail in a safer way e.g. don't output an but instead leave the parameter value as plain text? (This could be even more hacky than (2). How much broken metadata do we try and cope with?
fields.summary: A macro with a parameter of type URL will prevent the page it is on from being previewed or edited.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31463].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

When using the "Create from Template" macro, it will redirect to the dashboard and does not create anything. You can only create those templates from their original "create button" at the top bar.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Disable all three workbox plugins *OR* disable the In-app Notifications
# Create new page and try to use the "Create from template" macro. ex. meeting notes template.
# You will notice the macro redirects to the dashboard.
# Enable back all three workbox plugins
# Create new page and try to use the macro - Works properly

h4. Expectation

The Create from Template macro should work without depending on the workbox or in-app notification, or if it's dependent, it should produce a meaningful error message. 

h4.  Workaround

The workaround is to enable back all the Workbox plugins by sequence
# Enable the Notifications and Tasks - Common Plugin
# Enable the Notifications and Tasks - Host Plugin
# Enable the Notifications and Tasks - Confluence Provider Plugin
fields.summary: create from template macro redirects to dashboard when workbox is disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31457].
  {panel}

When a page has an Edit Restriction set to a page creator, it can't be moved or reordered by the page creator, unless he is a space admin. A user, who's a page creator, with non-space admin permission should be able to at least reorder a page within the same hierarchical level.
We need to allow this feature as it will be useful to some users.

For example:
*Page X* has 5 children pages *Page X1*, *Page X2*, *Page X3*, *Page X4*, and *Page X5* with this order.
*Page X* has no restrictions, *Page X1* has Edit restriction to +User A+, *Page X3* has Edit restriction to +User B+.
+User A+ won't be able to move *Page X1* to a position after *Page X3*. However, +User A+ and +User B+ can move *Page X2* (or any other unrestricted pages) to be after *Page X3*. This is inconvenience to some users.
fields.summary: Allow page creator to be able to reorder page that has Edit Restriction to himself

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The 'backupDaily' parameter in {{atlassian-confluence.log}} always shows {{true}}, regardless of whether the backup is enabled or not.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Confluence as administrator
 # Under *Confluence Admin >> General Configuration >> Scheduled Jobs*, disable the 'Back Up Confluence' job ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/scheduled-jobs-96567525.html])
 # Restart Confluence
 # Check the {{backupDaily}} entry in the Global Settings section within {{atlassian-confluence.log}}

h3. Expected Results

If the backup job is disabled, the log should show:
{code:java}
backupDaily=false
{code}
h3. Actual Results

Regardless of whether the job is enabled or not, the log shows:
{code:java}
backupDaily=true
{code}

h3. Workaround

To check if the backup job is enabled or not, you can check in any of the following 3 locations:

# In the UI: *Confluence Administration >> General Configuration >> Scheduled Jobs* : Check if 'Back Up Confluence' is disabled or scheduled (enabled)
# In the UI: *Confluence Administration >> General Configuration >> Backup Configuration* : Check if 'Perform backups' is disabled or enabled 
# In the database:
{code:java}
select * from bandana where bandanakey like '%DEFAULT#BackupJob%';
{code}
* If disabled, within the <enabled> tags you will see <value>0</value>
* If enabled, within the <enabled> tags you will see <value>1</value>
fields.summary: In system startup "backupDaily" parameter show as true even if we disable the daily backup job in Confluence UI.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31434].
  {panel}

This is getting ridiculous. This same issue exists in the newer version of Confluence. Fix it or effectively tell your customers (They pay for the product remember) to sod off.

=================

Confluence needs to support opening a link in a new window.  

Although I admit that it probably shouldn't use target as that's deprecated, it should still do it (article on standards compliant way: http://www.sitepoint.com/article/standards-compliant-world).

Wordpress does it and I use it all the time.  Within a week of us rolling out Confluence at my company, people have started asking for it.  

I am aware of the CONF-1210, CONF-7045, and CONF-6947 marked "Will not fix," but this is a simple feature found in competing products which users find useful and I wanted to open it again and get votes behind it.

The {link-to} macro doesn't do this for external links so it doesn't satisfy this requirement.
fields.summary: Open links in new window

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31414].
  {panel}

It would be great if Confluence could establish a plugin point to add arbitrary columns to the file lists used in the Attachments Macro and Tools->Attachments parts of the system. Some of our add-ons need to mark up the Attachments file lists with new columns, and we would love to have a standardized way to do this.

One possible implementation that would work for us would be along the following lines:

Create a new <web-item>, containing:
- an i18n column title to be inserted in the <th>
- a style class to be applied to the <th> and <td>
- a weight to position the column amongst other add-on links. For us, it would be sufficient to insert the plugin-supplied links all at the right hand side, immediately before any attachment actions...but if you wanted to go all-out and make all of the system attachment columns into their own web-items and permit a completely arbitrary rendering order, that would also work.
- a Velocity context containing just a reference to the attachment itself (and/or attachment version)

With the current implementation of the attachments macro and Tools->Attachments page, we would presumably need three different web-item sections:

1- the Tools->Attachments page,
2- the top-level Attachments Macro list (which contains just the file name and modified date), and
3- the Attachments Macro version list (containing the version name, creator and date)
fields.summary: Add Attachments Macro (and Tools->Attachments) plugin point to insert columns into file list

fields.description:
During the last days I encountered a dangerous behaviour which, several times already, inadvertently lead to cancelling the current page edit.
To reproduce:
1. Open a page containing a lot of content, so the page ca scroll up and down. (This is only to visualize a side-effect.)
2. In the center of the page, start typing following text:
bq. Test -> My test\-
After entering the second "-", AutoFormat will literally jump in. The line being edited will scroll to the bottom of the screen (This is the side-effekt I mentioned.). The last words will be replaced by strike-through test.
3. The usual reaction of a user is to press "Ctrl+Z" to undo this edit. Then the user will often use the backspace key in order to delete the second "-"
4. As a reaction to this last key press, Confluence will ask if the user wants to leave the page. (Of course this is not intended, and it is a totally wrong behaviour, since the blinking cursor visualizes that the user is in text edit mode, where the back key is only supposed to delete the last character, nothing else.). Press "Stay on page".
5. The already confused user might try again to delete the last "-" by pressing the back key. This results in *immediately* cancelling the editing session.

(Side note: The fact that AutoFormatting creates strike-through text is obviously undocumented on the shortcut help pages.)

In order to prevent further damage I have disabled Auto-Formatting for the moment.
fields.summary: Confluence cancelling page editing when trying to undo Auto-Formatting

  {panel}

Updating Confluence space sidebars is very manual and click-intensive.

Our Use Case:
We have ~15 spaces, and in addition to whatever links the space admins have, we administratively set links to a predetermined list of other spaces (the main space, HR, etc.). Every time we make a change or add a space, we need to go and manually update each space with the new link. We're only going to be adding spaces, which means an exponential growth in this process.

Suggestions:
1) Create a section somewhere in the Administration panel which allows admins to map a single sidebar to multiple spaces.

2) Allow admins to define a list of shortcuts for ALL spaces, which aren't editable by space admins.

If there's another ticket for this, please link and close; I looked but I couldn't find anything.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-31358].

The feature documented at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Changing+the+Sequential+Order+of+Pages?focusedCommentId=420184815&=#ChangingtheSequentialOrderofPages-Changingthepageordertoalphabetical is great, but it would be truly wonderful if reverse-sort were an option, particularly to support the Meeting Notes blueprint. Out-of-the-box use of Meeting Notes will produce a page tree that looks like this:
* Meeting Notes
** 2013-10-25 Meeting Notes
** 2013-10-26 Meeting Notes
** 2013-10-27 Meeting Notes

It's pretty clear imho that it's much more desirable to keep the latest meeting notes on top, as in:
* Meeting Notes
** 2013-10-27 Meeting Notes
** 2013-10-26 Meeting Notes
** 2013-10-25 Meeting Notes

But there is not a nice mechanism for making this happen without resorting to manual re-ordering. Imposing a simple reverse-alphabetical sort on the Meeting Notes child pages would do it (assuming an appropriate naming convention were used - like the one that the out-of-the-box Meeting Notes blueprint suggests).
fields.summary: Expand page order alphabetical sort to allow reverse sort
